The Survivor gains 1 extra die to roll for consecutive Actions of the specified type (Combat, Melee, or Ranged). The bonus is cumulative and applies until the end of the Survivor’s Turn. The bonus is lost whenever the Survivor performs another kind of Action. EXAMPLE: A Survivor with the Escalation: Ranged Skill spends their 1st Action performing a Ranged Action with a Pistol (Dice 1). Their 2nd Action is also spent for a Ranged Action, adding an additional die thanks to the Escalation Skill (Dice 2). The 3rd Action is spent for a Move Action. The Escalation bonus is lost.

The Survivor can use this Skill once during each of their Turns, for free. Select a Zone containing at least 1 Zombie and at least 1 Survivor at Range 1 from the Survivor. Both Zones need to share a clear path and a Line of Sight. Choose Survivors in the selected Zone to be dragged to the Survivor’s Zone without penalty. This is not a Move Action. A Survivor may decline the rescue and stay in the selected Zone if their player chooses.

The Survivor has a free Combat Action as long as they have Dual weapons equipped. This Action can be only used with the Dual equipped weapons.
The Survivor reloads reloadable weapons (Triple Crossbow, for example) for free.
Whenever the Survivor performs an Action of the indicated type (Combat, Magic, Melee, or Ranged), place a Freeze token (P. 33) in the targeted Zone (whether the Action succeeds or not).
The Survivor can use this Skill for free once during each of their Turns. They perform a free Melee Action using these characteristics. Melee modifiers (other Skills, for example) apply.
The Survivor can use this Skill for free once during each of their Turns. They perform a free Ranged Action using these characteristics. Ranged modifiers (other Skills, for example) apply.
This Skill is used whenever the Survivor performs a Guard Action. The designated Guards benefit from the specified Skill for the corresponding Action.
This Skill may be used whenever the Survivor performs a Move Guard Action. The Guards ignore Zombies in their starting Zone when performing the ensuing Move Action.

This Skill may be used whenever the Survivor performs a Guard Action. Instead of resolving the chosen Action, select a Zone at Range 1 from the designated Guard(s) within Line of Sight of them. All Zombies standing in the designated Guard(s)’ Zone are pushed to the selected Zone. This is not a Move. NOTE: Zombies can be pushed from Battlement Walkways to street Zones that way!

When the Survivor performs a Search Action and draws an Equipment card with the Dual symbol, they can immediately take a second card of the same type from the Equipment deck. Shuﬄe the deck afterward.
The Survivor benefits of the indicated Skill when performing a Ranged Action at Range 2 or more.
The Survivor may perform Melee Actions at Range 0-1.

An additional die can be rolled for each 6 rolled during an Action of the specified type (Combat, Magic, Melee, or Ranged). Keep on rolling additional dice as long as results of 6 keep happening. Game eﬀects that allow re-rolls must be used before rolling any additional dice for this Skill.

An additional die can be rolled for each 6 rolled on an Action of the specified type (Combat, Melee, or Ranged). Keep on rolling additional dice as long as the player keeps getting 6. Game eﬀects that allow re-rolls must be used before rolling any additional dice for this Skill.
The Survivor can perform Search Actions in Ruin Zones.
The Survivor considers Ruin Zones as street Zone when tracing Lines of Sight.
This Skill may be used once per Turn, right after the Survivor gets a Aaahh!! card while Searching. The Aaahh!! card is discarded without eﬀect and another card is drawn.
Draw 2 cards when Searching with the Survivor.
Draw 2 cards when Searching with the Survivor.
The Survivor can pick up Vault Weapon cards dropped by Abominations and Necromancers up to 1 Zone away and within Line of Sight. An open path between both Zones is required.
The Survivor can enter and leave Battlement Walkways without using Stairs or Rope Ladders.
When the Survivor spends 1 Action to Move, they can Move 1 or 2 Zones instead of 1. Entering a Zone containing Zombies still ends the Survivor’s Move Action.
The Survivor has 1 extra free Action and rolls an extra die with Actions using any kind of Explosives (see p.26).

This Skill can be used when the Survivor assigns their hits while resolving a Combat Action. If any 1 Zombie in that Zone is eliminated, the Survivor may eliminate 1 extra Zombie of the specified type in the same Zone. The Survivor gains the Adrenaline for the additional Zombie.
Removing Sleeper tokens costs only 1 Action.
At the end of the Zombie Phase, the Survivor gains 1free Action if at least 1 Survivor suﬀered any Wounds this Round.

Once per turn, you can re-roll all the dice related to the resolution of an Action made by the Survivor. The new result takes the place of the previous one. This Skill stacks with the effects of Equipment that allow re-rolls.

You can use this Skill any time the Survivor is about to get Wounded cards. Discard one Equipment card in your Survivor's inventory for each Wound he's about to receive. Negate a Wounded card per discarded Equipment card.

The Survivor makes no Noise. At all. His miniature does not count as a Noise token, and his use of Equipment or weapons produces no Noise tokens either! The Survivor may choose not to use this Skill at any time, if he wishes to be noisy.
